intro: Colignonia ovalifolia, commonly known as the oval-leaf colignonia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and smartweeds. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. Its leaves are oval-shaped and often have a distinctive waxy coating. Colignonia ovalifolia is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
